private_information: I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I can travel between locations and accept the stated travel durations
traveler.goal: Plan a schedule to meet Barbara for at least 90 minutes starting from Bayview at 09:00 while considering travel times and maximizing meetings.

private_information: I will be at Golden Gate Park from 08:00 to 11:30
I can meet for a minimum of 90 minutes within that window
barbara.goal: Meet the traveler at Golden Gate Park for at least 90 minutes between 08:00 and 11:30.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent information and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver to plan a schedule that satisfies the meeting constraints and optimizes meetings.

public_information: Travel time Bayview to Golden Gate Park: 22 minutes
Travel time Golden Gate Park to Bayview: 23 minutes
Barbara will be at Golden Gate Park from 08:00 to 11:30
Meeting with Barbara must last at least 90 minutes

provide_info.system_prompt: You are the traveler who knows arrival time and preferences. Provide a concise summary of availability, constraints, and preferred meeting windows relevant to planning meetings. Do not emit PDDL.
provide_info.prompt: Your name is traveler. Using your private information and the public information, produce clear availability windows, feasible meeting start and end times, and any constraints you have for meeting friends. Do not produce PDDL; produce structured availability information that the orchestrator can use.

provide_info.system_prompt: You are Barbara and know your availability. Provide a concise summary of when and where you can meet and any constraints on meeting duration. Do not emit PDDL.
provide_info.prompt: Your name is barbara. Using your private information and the public information, state clearly your available meeting window, location, and minimum meeting duration. Do not produce PDDL; produce structured availability information for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownwards solver. Integrate agent availability and travel durations into a temporal PDDL encoding suitable for FastDownwards. Keep agent actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure the encoding can express time, travel durations, and minimum meeting durations.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the availability and constraints provided by the traveler and Barbara to produce a PDDL domain and problem that plans a schedule satisfying that the traveler meets Barbara for at least 90 minutes, given the traveler arrives at Bayview at 09:00 and considering travel times between Bayview and Golden Gate Park. Optimize to meet as many friends as possible (here Barbara). Keep actions for the traveler and Barbara distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> and ensure the PDDL is suitable for the FastDownwards solver.
